Veteran Indiana Congressman Mike Pence said: Any increase in the debt ceiling should be married to very real and significant reductions in spending in the short term and the long term. Andy Coulson , who became Tony Blair David Cameron 's director of communications after last year's election, unexpectedly quit overnight conceding that his involvement in the affair made it difficult to give 110 per cent to his job. His departure sent shockwaves around Westminister and came just hours after the sudden resignation of one of Labour's most senior MPs, shadow chancellor Alan Johnson, who stepped down on Thursday night

Donald Rumsfeld : Maybe We Needed More Troops by Staff President Bush U.S. Defense Donald Rumsfeld is conceding "it's possible" too few troops were sent to invade Iraq. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on "Nightline" Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was "the most important failure in the execution of the war."
